80s but it's very very smart the idea is that you want to have a camera which can
be a normal cell phone camera which is essentially looking at a piece of silicon or an elastomer and then you
have structured light typically RGB colors that are shining onto this
elastomer now whenever you're touching this elastomer this will create the formations internally in the way that
the light is reflected back to the camera and will in practice create Shadows of different colors depending
from the geometry and and the force that is being applied to this elastomer
um and this is an extremely cool technology because has virtually no moving part the Silicon is the only

about reliability of the electronics and and the manufacturing because it's very easy we know how to manufacture camera

in audio and sentences but touch is more than this because it incorporates both structural information where we have a

slippage is heavily influenced over time and we also have
multi-modality because our skin is actually made of many different senses that we are integrating and again touch

small marbles glasses this is a task which seems for humans it's relatively
easy but for robots it's actually extremely hard and the reason is because you need at the same time being able to
move a marble between your two fingers but you also need to be able to modulate
the force between them and the marble so because if you apply too much force the marble will will be squeezed out
from its position if you apply to little Force you will lose the marble because of gravity so you need to be actually
doing very very fine manipulation at the border between you know of friction that
actually allow you to to move and keep the ball between your fingers and in
order to do this we actually used fairly Advanced machine learning algorithm items specifically in this paper we use
a model based reinforcement learning algorithms where we were taking raw
images from the sensor and we were essentially learning a lot in space or
feature representation if you are a deep learning person and then use this for making predictions into the future by
learning a forward Dynamics model so now given the two readings from the sensor
we were able to predict that if we were to apply a particular type of movement to my fingers this is how the next image
will look like and once we are able to use to have this forward Dynamics model which is by the
way also how humans work we are able to essentially plan what is
the best set of actions in order to reach our desired goal and this actually
work very well and more importantly it worked from raw images so we completely
sidestep the problem that a lot of tactile sensors have that they need to be calibrated here the robot does not
have an explicit idea of the concept of force but through the Dynamics model
through the reward it's able to learn what is what is good and what is bad in
terms of raw pixels and the fact that you know if you lose the marble well that's bad because you don't have the
